title: Number of missing persons files in the U.S. by race 2019
summary: This is a bar chart representing Race in the x axis and Number of missing persons in the y axis.
The Number of missing persons is appeared to be the highest at Race White and lowest at Race Indian.
The Number of missing persons of Race White is 34.44% larger than the minimum value at Indian.
min_summary: This bar chart has 5 columns on the x axis representing Race, and Number of missing persons in each Race on the y axis.
The Number of missing persons is highest at Race White and lowest at Race Indian.
mid_summary: This is a bar chart representing Race in the x axis and Number of missing persons in the y axis.
The Number of missing persons is appeared to be the highest at Race White and lowest at Race Indian.
The Number of missing persons of Race White is 34.44% larger than the minimum value at Indian.
max_summary: This is a bar chart representing Race in the x axis and Number of missing persons in the y axis.
The maximum Number of missing persons 359768.0 is found at Race White and the minimum is found at Indian where Race is 10447.0.
Race Black has the second highest value for Number of missing persons.
The maximum Race White has got 34.44 times higher Number of missing persons than the minimum Race Indian.
The Race White has the highest Number of missing persons, followed by Black, and Unknown. Down to the Race Indian which is the lowest.
The average Number of missing persons in all 5 Races is 121855.0.
The Number of missing persons is 609275.0 if we add up values of all Races.
